entry.title: Re: SAP S/4HANA Cloud: My Journey with AIF (Interface Monitoring) in Cloud Implementation so far
entry.content:
We are localizing three Central American countries (Guatemala, El Salvador, and Costa Rica) for the eDocument Cockpit and fiscal processes. We have successfully enabled accounting and commercial documents to reach the eDocument Cockpit and now want to generate the corresponding XML. However, when trying to create a Namespace in Configure Value Mapping, we found it is not possible. According to this blog:

‚ÄúNo Custom Namespaces are supported in Cloud ‚Äì so you cannot create your own namespace ‚Äì so no monitoring for Custom APIs. And in actual implementation, many of your interfaces would be based on Custom CDS views where you expose them as APIs. So you cannot use AIF for them on cloud.‚Äù

How can we move forward with this issue? S4 Hana Public Cloud 2508

entry.title: Integration of Batch-specific Unit of Measure( BSUOM) with EWM on SAP S/4HANA 2023 FPS01
entry.content:
Batch Specific UOM- It is an alternative unit of a material for which the conversion ratio to the base unit of measure can be defined on a batch-specific basis.

Primarily used in Steel, Pharma, Chemicals, Life sciences or its usage can be ubiquitous if Base to AUOM conversion is not fixed for the given product.

Batch Specific UOM( BSUOM) has 2 major attributes.

  1.  Proportion Unit
  2. Product Unit

This blog will focus primarily on Product Unit, Proportion Unit( Active Pharma Ingredient API) will be handled in Part II of this blog series.

Product Unit- Unit of measure that describes the total quantity of a material as an alternative to the base unit of measure.

Example. A piece of  particular material weighs 100 Kg, however in maximum cases, vendor weight size never adheres to fixed conversion ration maintained in material master like 1 PC=100 KG, sometimes it is more than standard conversion ratio. 

To handle this dynamic UOM conversion & incorporate different weight for each batch, SAP has tool called as Batch Specific UOM( BSUOM) to handle the quantity conversion on 'Batch Basis'. 

There are 3 major elements of Batch Specific UOM( BSUOM)

  • Base UOM
  • Alternate UOM( Product Unit)
  • Intermediate UOM

As a thump rule, Batch specific UOM( BSUOM) is always a alternate UOM which varies dynamically on batch basis. In Our case, Piece is always changing & hence it has to AUOM as 1 PC=105 KG, 1 PC=110 KG, 1PC=115 KG.

Base UOM= KG, Alternate UOM= PC

Batch Specific UOM( Intermediate UOM)= K/P( KG Per Piece)

How SAP Handles Batch Specific UOM( BSUOM)?

  • Define the KG( Weight) per Piece as a characteristic for batches.( CT04)

  • Create Intermediate UOM- CUNI- KG/P

  • Assign this Characteristics to a class and assign the class to Material Master.

  • Assign the class in Material Master of Product( A planned conversion ratio has to be maintained)

Configuration:

  • Activate Batch Specific UOM

SCM Extended Warehouse Management-->Cross-Process Settings-->Batch Management-->Activate Batch-Specific Units of Measure( This configuration can be activated from Batch Management side as well in OCHA)

  • Configure Product Quantities calculation( OCHA)

Quick check

Create a PO in Product Unit of Measure( AUOM)= PC

Batch specific UOM is supported in Synchronous posting 101 against Purchase Order( MIGO). What is supported and what are restriction is mentioned in SAP note( 3398656 - Release information and restrictions of batch-specific Unit of Measure in EWM on SAP S/4HANA 2023 FPS01

.Receiving of 1 PC.

 

Click on the classification tab and  enter KG/Piece of shipment =105( As lot received from supplier in this example)

Weight is dynamically adjusted bases on Conversion factor at characteristics level

 Doing 2 more GRs for 110 kg & 115 KG corresponding to 1 PC.

Check Stock Situation in EWM & S4.

In EWM, AUoM quantity = BUoM quantity divided by batch conversion factor.
Stock is always moved in the AUoM:
‚Ä¢ In warehouse task creation and
‚Ä¢ In warehouse task confirmation. 

S4 Stock

Rules of product unit of measure in EWM

AUoM quantity = BUoM quantity divided by batch conversion factor.
Stock is always moved in the AUoM:
‚Ä¢ In warehouse task creation and
‚Ä¢ In warehouse task confirmation.
No stock in warehouse without batch conversion factor maintained. 
‚Ä¢ At goods receipt posting or
‚Ä¢ Initial stock upload
For the AUoM = Product Unit only whole numbers (e.g. 1 PC, 10 PC, 3 PC) are allowed:
‚Ä¢ It must not be possible to get stock or warehouse tasks with decimal product unit values (AUoM)
‚Ä¢ BUoM can have decimal values.

Supported functionalities in EWM for Batch Specific UOM

Limitation:

‚Ä¢ More than one product unit for one material
‚Ä¢ All synchronous postings except for movement type 101
‚Ä¢ EWM TM integration

  • Decentral EWM( In Roadmap S/4 HANA 2025)

Check SAP note for list of detailed limitation.

3398656 - Release information and restrictions of batch-specific Unit of Measure in EWM on SAP S/4HANA 2023 FPS01

References: SAP¬Æ Extended Warehouse Management in SAP S/4HANA ... - SAP Community

All test is performed in S/4 HANA 2023 FPS02 Sandbox System

entry.title: Configure Value Mapping. APP eDocument for a non-localized country CE2508
entry.content:
Hello community,

For non-localized countries in SAP Cloud Public Edition, we found these applications in the documentation: Configure Value Mapping. However, for non-localized countries (Central America), we don't have the option to create the namespace for that country; /EDOXX (where XX is the country). The country isn't available in the list.

With extensibility, which BAdI should be implemented or in which application should this namespace be created?

entry.title: Re: Problems faced while using my SAP BTP Trial Account
entry.content:
Hi Peter,

Thanks for providing the necessary information. I logged-in just to update my comments with same observations regarding problem #1, after searching more online.

Problem 2 however resolved itself so it might be a temporary issue, as previously I had re-booted my device after uninstalling and installing Eclipse again.

In my case "Create" button was disabled for both OData versions with or without draft. After problem 2 resolved itself, I could see a warning in V4 Service binding that it will be read-only if draft mode is not enabled.

Once again thanks for your help. I have accepted your answer.

PS - I also enabled BAS in my trial account and tried to do a Full Stack ABAP App. At the beginning itself, I was asked for a package and a transport. I created a TR using ADT and then referred the same. Is this the right approach?

Regards

Abhijit Moholkar

entry.title: Re: How to handle empty Profit Centers during Realignment...
entry.content:
Realignment should be able to handle profit center empty, but profit center value will not substituted as the target fields for realignment and GRPL are seven GR fields in ACDOCA. 
Please try to implement note 3436316 - Realignment: restriction of profit center does not work as expected to see whether realignment works with profit center empty.

entry.title: Re: My sales order VA01 transaction timed out
entry.content: Thanks for the detailed answer. I have also a proposed solution of looping a maximum of 5 times. DO 5 times. Then I clear vbak and exit the loop. Will this help? Aside from that, my other question is the root cause. Is there something wrong with the data? Sold to party? Ship to party? Material number? Is there something missing or wrong with the sales document itself? Why did it not save in table VBAK? By the way the variable d_bapiso was populated from VBAK-VBELN. If there is a long running job in the background will it affect the saving to table VBAK? Hope you guys shed more light on this one. Thanks Newguy_cloud

entry.title: SAP BTP Neo Environment: Problem calling iflow from SAP Fiori
entry.content:
Hi everyone
I developed an application in SAPUI5 in a Neo environment. Running the application from SAP Web IDE Full-Stack (version: 201119) works correctly, but when deploying it to SAP Fiori, I receive a 405 error.

SAP Web Ide full

 

It is evident from sap fiori that it returns status 405

It uses a destination with an OAuth2ClientCredentials, and neo-app.json and manifest.json are configured for destinations.

 

Any suggestions on how to resolve this error?

Chai Fong

entry.title: Why does the FRUN need the Introscope Enterprise Manager?
entry.content:
Hello SAP, 

We are upgrading FRUN 4.0 to FRUN 5.0 , as per the RACI sheet "note DIGITS - Introscope 10.8 Release Notes" says to install Introscope 10.8. But in our system we do not have Introscope installed, given the logs for installation patch of Introscope. 

Best regards,


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Why does the FRUN need the Introscope Enterprise Mana...
entry.content:
Dear Customer, 

To ensure performance data collection for non-ABAP managed systems within your network, such as JAVA, BOE, DS, Tomcat, SAP Convergent Charging, and similar products, it is necessary to install one CA Introscope EM per customer network.

This installation is mandatory to enable monitoring and data collection for these systems in FRUN. If these products are present in your environment, please proceed with the installation to facilitate seamless system monitoring.

Please see:

  • Preparing CA APM Enterprise Manager
  • 797147 - Introscope Installation for SAP Customers
  • 3247270 - Introscope 10.8 Release Notes

Best regards,
Vera Jiang

entry.title: Re: Why Can a Contract with Blocked Status in the Source...
entry.content: Hello, Thank you very much for your detailed response. It turns out that I had overlooked the fact that the delivery date of the purchase requisition must fall within the validity period of the source list. The test material I was using has a long procurement lead time, which caused the delivery date to fall outside the valid period in the source list. I‚Äôll also include the additional points you mentioned in my next round of testing and update the configurations accordingly. Thanks again for your helpful insights!

entry.title: Can cost estimate perform by quarterly or half yearly?
entry.content:

The company currently implements cost estimation within the following timeframes:

What I know is that the period is mainly based on the costing date from, 

According to the figure, only the cost for August is actually calculated.

and want to calculate the average cost for a period as the standard cost for that period.

What IMG should be adjusted or how should it be operated?

 

Thank you for your reply!
